text: Morning guys. How are you all using local dev with sass and multiple devs? Do you push to a git repo then to HubSpot? Looking for an effective way both myself and another dev can code locally on the same project.

I'm thinking about feature branches and pull requests to master. Master has github actions/bitbucket pipelines to retrieve changes from HubSpot and push changes to HubSpot. I'm not sure if that is going to work I don't have a lot of experience with building on repository platforms.

These two articles should help you guys. Every development team is different, but these articles should help give you guys a starting point.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/creating-an-efficient-development-workflow>
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/github-integration>
I’m getting some errors for the first time developing locally
`[ERROR] A RequestError has occurred. Error: ESOCKETTIMEDOUT`
It was working fine all morning, trying to figure out what happened
known issue maybe?
i got that while working in the CMS on a chatflow a bit ago. maybe some server issue?
I guess I’ll wait for now
But couldn’t have happened at a worse time as these things usually go
they could be unrelated. but yeah, timing is never good
I reached out to regular support to hopefully trigger a series of events
Should be better now
It is! Thanks.
We are going to use CircleCI. Right now we just create multiple sandbox environments.
We have written some listeners to sync code on every change. Works rather efficient, but not with multille devs in the same environment.

a path we used when building the developer docs site that worked well, all of the devs used a sandbox portal to work on the templates, modules, code etc. Using git to manage branching and merging. That way developers never conflicted on code. Master is our deployed live site. For our own purposes we added a deploy script to our package.json to facilitate syncing master with the prod portal. 

_So if you didn’t know_ *the docs are built on the CMS using the same features you have*, _now you know._

Love to hear what everyone’s workflow has been.

```> npx hs filemanager upload assets/Branding /```
Yields an error:
```[ERROR] Uploading file "/home/runner/work/HubSpot/HubSpot/assets/Branding/LogoTightFit.png" to "/LogoTightFit.png" failed
[ERROR] Unable to upload "/home/runner/work/HubSpot/HubSpot/assets/Branding/LogoTightFit.png". The post to "/LogoTightFit.png" in portal XXXXXXX failed due to a server error. Please try again or visit <https://help.HubSpot.com/> to submit a ticket or contact HubSpot Support if the issue persists. internal error```
Any ideas?
Guessing it might be related to <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CLJJXGTC0/p1587481048206700>

Great articles! It is the setup I was thinking about. One question, `You can lock projects within the Design Manager by right-clicking on a folder and selecting “Lock folder” to prevent anyone from editing files in the Design Manager.`. Does that mean the folder can be unlocked the same way? There are some of our clients who have a mind of their own and start changing things.
